slides.title: Hello JavaScript
slides.content:
# JavaScript Basics âš¡

JavaScript (JS) is the programming language of the web. It makes pages interactive.

## Adding JS

```html
<script>
  console.log("Hello World!");
</script>
```

Or typically in an external file:
```html
<script src="script.js"></script>
```

slides.title: Variables
slides.content:
# Variables ðŸ“¦

Containers for storing data.

## Keywords
- `let`: Can be reassigned (Modern standard)
- `const`: Cannot be reassigned (Constant)
- `var`: Old way (Function scoped, avoid if possible)

```javascript
let score = 10;
const pi = 3.14;
var name = "Old School";
```

> ðŸ’¡ **Tip:** Default to `const`. Use `let` only if the value needs to change.

slides.title: Data Types
slides.content:
# Data Types ðŸ’¾

JS is dynamically typed.

- **String**: `"Hello"` or `'Hi'`
- **Number**: `42` or `3.14`
- **Boolean**: `true` or `false`
- **Undefined**: Variable declared but not assigned
- **Null**: Intentional absence of value
- **Object**: `{ name: "Alice" }`
- **Array**: `[1, 2, 3]`

Check type with `typeof`: `typeof "hi" // "string"`

slides.title: Operators
slides.content:
# Operators âž•

## Arithmetic
`+`, `-`, `*`, `/`, `%` (Remainder)

## Assignment
`=`, `+=`, `-=`

## Comparison
- `==`: Loose equality (`5 == "5"` is true)
- `===`: Strict equality (`5 === "5"` is false) **Use this!**
- `!=`, `!==`, `>`, `<`

## Logical
- `&&` (AND)
- `||` (OR)
- `!` (NOT)
